channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Germany’s economic engine misfires again, fueling election uncertainty
item.description: German GDP declined 0.2% last year, for its second straight year of contraction.

item.title: Defending Michigan’s Auto Industry, Whitmer Warns of Tariff Risks
item.description: Gov. Gretchen Whitmer addressed the Detroit Auto Show, saying that tariffs should not be used “to punish our closest trading partners,” like Canada.

item.title: TikTok’s CEO used to be Mark Zuckerberg’s intern—now he’s his fiercest competitor
item.description: Shou Zi Chew interned at Facebook during his time at Harvard Business School.

item.title: Coffee company will pay you $75,000—plus health insurance, travel costs, and more—to tour the country and document the trip on social media
item.description: Chameleon Coffee looks for two members of its “Brew Crew.”

item.title: Porsche crisis renews calls for part-time CEO Oliver Blume to relinquish dual role at Volkswagen
item.description: Soaring costs, declining vehicle sales and problems in China are raising pressure on Oliver Blume to cede one of his two CEO jobs.

item.title: Missile Attack Prompts Emergency Power Cuts in Ukraine
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said air defenses had shot down at least 30 missiles from a “massive” barrage that had targeted gas and energy...

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire ‘Right on the Brink,’ and the S.E.C. Sues Elon Musk
BlackRock and Vanguard own huge amounts of bank shares—but only one agrees with FDIC policy on undue influence
item.description: Vanguard has already signed an agreement with the FDIC while BlackRock is reportedly pushing to delay until the Trump administration takes over later ...

item.title: Drake Sues Universal Music Over Kendrick Lamar’s ‘Not Like Us’
item.description: In a federal lawsuit on Wednesday, Drake accused Universal Music Group of putting his life and reputation at risk by releasing and promoting the popul...

item.title: Mozambique Is at a Crossroads as a New President Is Sworn In
item.description: Daniel Chapo was sworn in at a time of widespread anger directed at his party, Frelimo, which has led the country for 50 years and has been accused of...

item.title: Are Biden and Trump at Odds on Global Energy Strategy? Maybe Not So Much.
item.description: When it comes to gas exports and competition with China, the two administrations share a similar vision, the top U.S. energy diplomat says.
